As I mentioned, I stayed there because of a function there. If I was going to Branson for any other reason I would probably stay at a more up to date chain hotel. Branson is a nice town, nice folks, temp not bad for summer time, and family friendly. Its alot like Gatlinburg, TN, just a bit smaller. We drove from the Kansas City airport, which was almost 4 hours. I would recommend flying into Springfield instead. Its about a 1 hour drive from there. But overall its a nice town and I had a nice stay at the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, quiet and comfortable with affordable rates!”
Reviews.Author: ambreana
Reviews.Content: Will definately return when in the Branson area. The room was very large and comfortable, clean, quiet, great location. Room service was very willing to help. Rates were very affordable. Full buffet breakfast was outstanding! Two swimming pools for the kids.

Reviews.Title: “regular rooms are very cramped”
Reviews.Author: 650savag
Reviews.Content: We booked a regular king room for 5 nites and left after the 2d nite. would have left after the first nite but would have had to pay the second night anyway. The hotel is overall alright and the theme rooms or suites may be roomier but the regular rooms are very cramped. we had a king bed which was pretty comfortable . there was one very small, round table and 2 small, straight back chairs. two nite stands and the armoir for the tv and that was it for the furniture. you could barely sqeeze between the foot of the bed and the armoir. the bathroom was very small with a tub/shower and comode. the sink was in the ;main room which wasn't very well designed. The hotel had some nice decor and was probably v ery nice when it was newer, but needs to be updated and new carpet. The breakfast was very good and there was lots of room for every\one to sit and eat. they had some pretty good entertainment each morning for breakfast. We got good rates on our room because they sent us a coupon by email and if you don't mind being cramped, it was a good bargain. We just wanted more room and a bed with a pillow top mattress. We won't stay here again unless they offer the theme rooms and suites at a fair price.

Reviews.Title: “Not 4 star, but overall satisfied!”
Reviews.Author: evansmom95
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Jungle suite this weekend, and we're satisfied .The room was spacious,clean, and comfortable. The location of the hotel was great. Staff was friendly. The breakfast was horrible though, We kept eating though because it was complimentary (and we'd spent a fortune already on attractions,food, etc. Boy was that a mistake! Here's a tip for ya... Don't check out before eating breakfast because you're gonna need that bathroom before you hit the road!!!!! But overall we would recommend this hotel especially for families, We can't wait to go back with our son to maybe stay in the MLB or medieval suite, for breakfast we'll definitly eat elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, breakfast, and entertainment during breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: heillefam
Reviews.Content: Very nice place to stay. I've stayed there in the last five years and have stayed at this hotel 15 times.

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay here again! please don't make the same mistake we did!”
Reviews.Author: andonsmom
Reviews.Content: My family booked one room at the Stone Castle Inn for July 4th- July 9th this year. I always do research on trip advisor every year before deciding where to stay, I have decided that one persons trash is definetly another person's treasure after this year in Branson. I choose this hotel after reading all the good reviews on here when I really should have listened to the bad! We ended up leaving a day early and arrived at the hotel on the 3rd, around 2a.m., the women at the front desk was very nice and helpful. She scanned my card and gave us the key to our room, when we got up there I figured up the price of our rooms, I was quoted $59.99 a night for a double queen for the 1st five nights, then we were going to move to a suite the last night which I was quoted $99. I figured up the total and it only came to a little more than $400, but she charged me $526. I called down to the front desk and told her this and she apologized and said that someone had put the rate at $99 for the double queen and that she hadn't even figured in the suite yet, so that was $200 more than we were supposed to be charged, she then told me that it was just a hold on my account until we checked out and it would drop off when we were actually billed. She told me to speak to someone in the morning. The next morning I went back to the office and was told that there is nothing they could do until Tuesday because of the Holiday weekend and I needed to speak to the office manager. Monday I went to the front desk again and the general manager was there, when I spoke to him he didn't even act like he cared! I told him that because of there mistake we were out $200 in our checking account because it was being held. Tuesday I again went and talked to the general manager who actually did contact my bank and got them to release the hold, thank goodness, but when I talked to him about some other problems that I had he acted like he did not care at all. OK now on to some of the problems ;) Upon arriving in the room we always check the sheets and blankets, just to make sure ya know. One of the beds had a crusty stain on the blanket, have know idea what it was nor do I want to know, we were so tired that my husband just pulled it off and slept on the sheets, which were ok I guess. In front of the sink was a huge water spot, I mean it was soaked, like someone got out of the shower and drip dried in that spot, I did call the office about this and they did take care of it, my husband put a towel over it the 1st night and when he lifted it it was nasty! The was some white stain on the floor in front of the bathroom, again gross! When we got back to the motel the 1st day, housekeeping had made my bed but had not touched my husbands, we called for clean linens and they had someone bring them up, we had to make the bed ourselves. The second day they didn't put everything on the beds just left them lying in the corner of the room. The rooms are small, the bathrooms tiny, the swimming pools are ok, the hot tub did not have enough water in it and the breakfast, we tried it once and after that we ate at Starvin Marvin's, which was delicious, review coming for them also. Had we not had issues with the money situation we would have left and gone to another motel, as it was we did not stay in the suite but went to another motel for $20 more which was alot nicer. Oh about that, I went to the office and told them that we would not be staying in the suite and the woman at the counter told me to just tell them in the morning when we check out so I did and they asked me why I did say something the day before, so I told them what happened, they were basically going to charge me for that night because the girl wouldn't cancel it the night before, but thank goodness did not.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate but marginal”
Reviews.Author: chowhound03
Reviews.Content: Not a bad place, but not very good either. No proximity to any of Branson's activities or good restaurants. Have to drive everywhere. Small room, cramped with furniture. Dogs are permitted and they bark a lot. Have to pay extra $ for refrigerator in room. Free morning breakfast very sparse--no breakfast meats or potatoes. Just scrambled eggs, biscuits, gravy. Looks a bit worn out and not kept up to par. Would not return to this place again.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful place to stay!! Great rooms and friendly staff!!”
Reviews.Author: rhondakelly
Reviews.Content: This the best hotel with the wonderful beutiful rooms. The live show they have in the morning for breakfast was a joy to see.  The staff was helpful and all of them so friendly  I would bring the entire family for a fun time in branson. Do your self a favor and stay at The Stone Castle you will not regret it.

Reviews.Title: “OH MY LORD”
Reviews.Author: apdchief
Reviews.Content: This was by far the worst place I have ever attempted to stay! The staff was very helpful but could not find an unstained pilliow in the entire complex! Out of 7 pillows all but one was stained and even Josh the young man who brought us the pillows and sheet said he would let the GM know about the status of these nasty pillows! Upon booking this hotel with ReserveBranson.com I checked tripadvisor and most reviews said good things.! Were these people blind? or they didnt check the sheets and blankets! There were some bad reviews too. I called and ensured our reservation and the lady told me it was confirmed! I asked her if the hotel was clean and she assured me it was. Well room 506 was not clean and the hallway stunk and as we entered into the room the floor was wet from the sink leaking. The sheet on one of the beds had copper colored stains near the top and the pillows were stained really bad. Staff was nice and sent pillows to our room three times and sheets once. One of the pillows I checked just before my 8 year old daughter was about to put her head down on it and it appeared to be molded. I have pictures on my phone and will post after I transferr them to my computer. We were only there for like three hours. At 11pm I contacted the Holiday Inn Express on Green Mountian Drive and Josh gave me a great rate to help compensate the poor quality of the Stone Castle. I had to take my wife, 6 week old daughter, and my 8 year old daughter out at 11 pm to take them to a clean place for them to sleep! I have called reservebranson and am awaiting their call back. I will comment again when they refund my money for the stained castle Inn.....I mean Stone Castle Inn. DON'T STAY AT STONE CASTLE

Reviews.Title: “My girls were pincesses in a Castle”
Reviews.Author: luckymranch
Reviews.Content: Great time, pool was the warmest indoor pool ever, the decor is awesome, breakfast great, price was exceptional. will stay again!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Thanks for a great stay!”
Reviews.Author: bransonhappy
Reviews.Content: We looked for a nice hotel online several months before deciding and we were not disappointed! It's a wonderful hotel with a quiet, convenient location! We really enjoyed our 4 night stay! The rooms were clean, beds were super comfy... and we slept like babies every night. We never heard a peep from any of the rooms next to us. The service was great and staff was very friendly! The hot breakfast was yummy too! The indoor pools are very nice and are kept very clean...my kids never wanted to get out! Would definitely recommend!

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: cindyarb
Reviews.Content: We were celebrating our 22nd anniversary. We had reservations for a double standard room. When we arrived, they offered to bump us up to one of their theme rooms because they needed our room. Without hesitation we jumped on the opportunity. We had the "Pirates of the Carribean Room". It was wonderful! We loved the decor and the large jacuzzi tub and private balcony. The staff was so nice and took very good care of us. The breakfast was good and the breakfast entertainment was a nice touch. We highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “wouldnt stay there again”
Reviews.Author: mipegjunior8
Reviews.Content: I booked this with travelocity, around 50 per night. I called the hotel before I booked it, making sure I could get a room with wi-fi and pet free, they said no problem. The check in was fast. We got to the room, looked good, nice furnishings. I was unable to get online. I called the front desk, they said they would have the IT person reset the router. I waited, waited, waited. Still nothing. I then took my laptop to the front desk. The clerk got me online. Went back to my room, nothing. I went back down to front desk. They offered us another room, I went up to the new room with my laptop to verify it worked, That room had some sort of problem above the a/c unit that looked like it had water damage. I went back down to front desk, was given a third room to try. I went back upstairs, wi-fi worked, room looked ok. It was kinda moldy around the bathtub. We then moved all of our stuff to this 3rd room. After traveling for many hours and being wore out and tired, we just wanted to be settled in. The exterior doors had problems locking. We were a bit concerned about security in the hotel. I researched reviews on many hotels before our trip, I was really hopeful that this would meet our standards. But it didn't. Only in the price. Also, it did not have a fridge. My back was killing me from all of the walking and moving our stuff and I wanted to heat up my microwave heating pad, I had to walk down to the front desk, they unlocked a banquet room, the only microwave was in there. That was inconvenient. The tv was older, did not have many channels at all, mainly a news channel, tbs, a few others, No HBO or premium channels. The staff was friendly. In summary, I would not stay here again, I would have chosen The Radisson.

Reviews.Title: “Our Stay.”
Reviews.Author: Purplehummingbird
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our three day two night stay with you. We're looking forward to returning with our grandchildren as they will love your castle theme. Your convenient location has made our stay more enjoyable. We're looking forward to visiting your hotel many times in the future.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our stay and wish we weren't so tired”
Reviews.Author: bciocco
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving, the front desk staff was friendly and welcoming. We did not have a reservation and the clerk allowed us to look at several of the theme rooms to select one we liked. My wife and I stayed one night in the Jungle room. We liked it. The theme was nice and not over the top. The room had a king bed and a whirlpool tub. We had been traveling for a couple of days and went to see the Stafford show. When we got back to the room we were so tired we fell asleep before getting to use the tub. There is a breakfast buffet and, the morning we were there, two singers were entertaining at breakfast. I thought it a little loud for 7 AM. Many of the other guests seemed to be enjoying it (I think we were the youngest guests in the room and we are in our 40s). The buffet is complete: cold cereal, biscuits and gravy, waffles, eggs, bacon, etc. The only thing missing were pastries. There were some donuts that looked like they came out of a box. The only downside was the TV. It was a 19" or so standard definition TV. In some sense I was not surprised as the room is designed more for romance than TV watching. I recommended the hotel to my niece and her husband for their honeymoon. Their wedding was the reason we were passing through Branson.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Wait to go Back!!!”
Reviews.Author: JT005
Reviews.Content: This isn't your ordinary hotel. The theme rooms are very unique, fun, romantic, interesting and relaxing. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone! Hotel staff is kind and courtous and willing to make your stay enjoyable!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!!!”
Reviews.Author: BirdieOklahoma
Reviews.Content: We planned a last minute trip to Branson to enjoy Silver Dollar Cities 50th B-day Celebration. I booked this hotel without ever seeing it before. We were pleasantly surprised!! It was GREAT!!! My son loved the Castle Theme, the gameroom and the pool. The extended pool hours were great since we went to a show. The beds were very comfortable and we slept great. They have a free full breakfast with eggs and waffles. They even had breakfast entertainment that was pretty good. Some of the rooms have themes. We were able to tour a few of the rooms and they were really neat. We will be staying again very soon!! Great Hotel....Great Locations......Can't wait to go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Okay for the price”
Reviews.Author: Heather B
Reviews.Content: My spouse and I stayed here one night, standard room. The window leaked and the phone had the wrong room number on it. We had a towel with a pee stain in the middle of it. Around midnight we decided to go the hot tub, it was crowded with kids! No parents just kids. Decor was nice but that was the only highlight of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome service. Best place in town!”
Reviews.Author: mclairday
Reviews.Content: The service was great! The staff was super friendly and very helpful. The room was beautiful and the beds were some of the most comfortable beds I had ever slept in. My teenage boy and girl were with us and really enjoyed the pools and the hot tubs. When it was time to go the kids begged to stay longer. It is conviently located close to Walmart and many stores that we commonly shop. I give this Hotel the highest available.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place for a conference!”
Reviews.Author: Hall4him
Reviews.Content: We were part of a three day conference for about 40 couples. The rooms were clean, the beds were comfortable, the staff was professional and friendly and the conference rooms were perfect for our group. A good hot breakfast was included and the hotel was convenient to other Branson attractions. I would highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: mom7777
Reviews.Content: I just want to say that this hotel is by the far the best I've stayed at! The rooms are super clean and service is amazing! The continental breakfast is the best tasting......even better than the restaurants!! I am definately coming back here!

Reviews.Title: “The taste of excellents”
Reviews.Author: dave479
Reviews.Content: this is the best hotel i have ever stayed in. the rooms are so clean. the beds are so fresh and smell good.so close to sleeping in my own beds. very nice. the bathrooms are so clean. and i love that you have everything in the room you need. ironing board,iron and so forth. the indoor pools .... wow. love them. the kids love staying there. the breakfast is grand. the staff and mangement are great. the are willing to help you . great location. want to thank them all. we stay there all the time. david cope dave4792004@yahoo.com

Reviews.Title: “a springbreak get away to remember with a smile.”
Reviews.Author: dcovermon
Reviews.Content: at the stone castle hotel it is highly a must to see and stay at,from its three castles and two indoor heated pools and two spas it also is equipt with a family arcade,gift shop,laundry and a hot deliciuos breakfast each morning and if thats not enough it also has for your convience high speed internet and a computer for your use in the lobby.the rooms are newly remolded with pillow top beds,table and chairs,restroom etc needs,ironing board and iron,and a blow dryer.the tvs are meduim size and cable tv.this hotel is right smack in the heart of branson.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel with wonderful beds”
Reviews.Author: Lamar_Mo_Momma
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time at the hotel. It was clean and very nice and the front desk staff was wonderful as well.

Reviews.Title: “I totally loved it the rooms are great and the service is the best”
Reviews.Author: jeneramsey
Reviews.Content: If you are to stay at this Hotel I would like you to know tha they have great rooms fair prices and great service, the game room was cool and they also have 2 indoor pools! It was a great stay

Reviews.Title: “Great Branson Hotel”
Reviews.Author: catKC
Reviews.Content: My husband and I really enjoyed staying at the Stone Castle Hotel. The service was excelent, and the staff was very friendly. We stayed in a standard room with a king bed. The room was very clean and decorated very nicely. There was all the standards for a nice hotel room, there was even a coffee maker. The location was just off the strip, which we liked. The price was great. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxation on a low budget”
Reviews.Author: ElderJim
Reviews.Content: We found the staff to be extremely nice and accomodating. Every request was fulfilled like we were the owner. The room was neet, clean, and more than adequate for our needs. The continental breakfast was wonderful and well organized. We slept well with absolutely no sound from the outside. Check in and check out were fast and easy.

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: Jdbelt
Reviews.Content: When my wife and I were trying to find a hotel to stay in for a weekend family vacation, we came across this hotel. After looking at the website, we were cautiously optimistic that what we saw was a reality rather than some internet scam. So we called, booked our room, and the next day hit the road to Branson. All the way during the drive, we both joked that we'd booked a stay at a dump, but once we arrived, we were pleasantly surprised to find an actual hotel, with actual people. When we saw our room, our smiles deepened. Very warm, cozy, and comfortable rooms. Breakfast was warm and fresh, the people were all very friendly. The receptionist on duty even allowed us to look at one of their famous themed rooms, and that solidified our view that we would definitely be back! And truthfully, we can't wait to get back to our new hidden gem!

Reviews.Title: “Older Hotel Recently Renovated”
Reviews.Author: Team07
Reviews.Content: Nothing to write home about. It was a comfortable room but was not very clean. Heard several people at front desk complaining of hair in their bathtub upon arrival and general complaints about their room, our bathtub was never cleaned while we were there. Bedspreads were messed up when we arrived. Very dark rooms and could hear every sound from the room next to us. Breakfast was ok but poorly stocked, there were only ~10 rooms rented while we were there so no excuse for overcrowded. This is just an older hotel that they have tried to fixed up but too many tale tale signs of aging. We stayed in one of the regular rooms and toured the themed rooms ($50.00) more a night, I'm glad we did not pay extra for a room that was the same as ours except for murals on the walls and an old whirlpool tub, would never recommend a themed room. If you get the room free like we did I guess it would be worth it, I'm glad we did not pay for it (time share presentation). It was certainly worth free. I would not return unless it was at no cost.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, affordable!”
Reviews.Author: normalc99
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Settle Inn/Stone Castle in Branson, MO. We were wanting a relaxing romantic getaway and they were awesome! The room was nicely appointed, clean, and the bed was very comfortable. It was great having breakfast on site. The hotel is centrally located in Branson. We will make use of it again, I am sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great services with a smile”
Reviews.Author: srnurse
Reviews.Content: I was impressed with the facility and service. It was clean and inviting atmosphere. The employees were very nice and professional. I would recommend this facility to friends or business partners.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Shihi91
Reviews.Content: Our stay was very enjoyable. The breakfast was a large assortment and very good. The room service was very good and clean. It was an excellent experience. I also chose this hotel because it had an indoor swimming which had a really nice warm temperature. The hot tub was also really nice.

Reviews.Title: “We love it!!! Wouldn't want to stay anywhere else in Branson!”
Reviews.Author: settleinnfan
Reviews.Content: I have looked and looked for the best deal in Branson for our family trips. I can say without a doubt this is the best! We love it and wouldn't want to stay anywhere else. The service is good, rooms are clean, breakfast is good, price is reasonable and my little girl absolutely loves the pool!!!! I don't even look for other hotels now when planning a trip to Branson. My little girl thinks it is the only place to go in Branson!!!! Keep up the good work!

Reviews.Title: “Excellant”
Reviews.Author: grammy_cook
Reviews.Content: I loved everything about it. The room was clean. The breakfast was great.

Reviews.Title: “Very Dissapointing”
Reviews.Author: JennyC1
Reviews.Content: We stayed her for 4 nights over the Thanksgiving Holiday and very pretty uncomfortable the entire time. Rooms were nice in decor but there was dirt under the beds, TV was tiny, wireless internet was horrible, room was very small, pool and hot tub were tiny and full of rowdy kids with no one enforcing the rules of no jumping or horseplay, could not enjoy it at all. "DELUXE" continental breakfast was not bad if you could get near it, crowd were backed up across the parking lot and we finally gave up and went elsewhere. Dog was barking in room across the hall all day and night, one of us stepped in dog feces in the parking lot and tracked it into the room :( A group of ill guests vomited just outside the entry door, massive amounts, when we called to ask that it be cleaned up due to health hazards front desk staff was rude! It was a very dissapointing place to stay ~ NEVER again

Reviews.Title: “No hot water.”
Reviews.Author: St_Louis_Engineer
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night over Thanksgiving weekend. No hot water for a shower at 7am. Will never stay here again. Had to stop someone in the parking lot to find out where the lobby is to check in.

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Scotlandtravels
Reviews.Content: The room smelled musty when we first walked in. Later found large water spot with mildew on bathroom ceiling. When we notified front desk, they just said "oh" . We asked for another room. Hotel needs updating. Rooms are dark and dingy (black carpet?) and small. You literally had to turn around to get into the bathroom. We wanted to upgrade to a larger room, but only standard rooms are pet friendly. With all the choices in Branson, we would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: mamabear32
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 nights and enjoyed every bit of it. We would definately stay here again. Our room was very nice the bathroom was a bit small for my husband but he is 6' 7" and weighs 280 pounds!! It is in a very quiet location which we enjoyed. The front desk was very helpful and very nice. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Just "okay" for family reunion”
Reviews.Author: TwinzFam
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Settle Inn (now Stone Castle Hotel and Conference Center) for a family reunion in July. Our experience was just "okay". We stayed in a room which I assume was supposed to be a suite, however it was really just adjoining rooms. One room was very warm. We called the front desk to report that our air conditioning was not working. To the hotel's credit, we had a visit from maintenance very quickly. However, we were told that one of the rooms had an older air conditioning unit and that it just wouldn't get as cool as the other. Unfortunately, my husband and I were stuck in the warmer room. We also had a great deal of difficulty with the wireless internet. My husband was on a working vacation and needed constant contact with the office back home as he was in the middle of a business transaction. We never did get our computer on the wireless network even after taking our laptop to the front desk. The front desk person said they knew nothing about it and couldn't help us. My husband ended up standing by the window and picking up wireless from a nearby business. It was extremely frustrating. However, the rooms were clean enough, breakfast was fairly good and we enjoyed the location off the main strip. All in all...just okay.

Reviews.Title: “Stone Castle Hotel is the best-kept secret in Branson!”
Reviews.Author: delapp1
Reviews.Content: Since we love Branson and often visited our daughter during her 4 years at College of the Ozarks, we've stayed in many local motels, hotels, cabins and even a time-share. When a friend recommended the Stone Castle Hotel, formerly known as Settle Inn, I was skeptical. Our family recently needed a one-night get-away, so I took a chance and called Stone Castle Hotel. The medieval atmosphere is great! The service could not have been better. Our room was large with two wonderful queen beds. The free wireless high speed internet was appreciated. We loved the beautiful theme-related framed art in the room, too. The free breakfast included biscuits and gravy, scrambled eggs, waffles, cereal, coffee and juice --- much more than a continental breakfast. We highly recommend this hotel and look forward to a longer stay there in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice personel and clean atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: pickyone54
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in several hotels in Branson but this is one that we would definatly return to. The hotel in all is very clean and the standard rooms are very spacious. The free breakfast was very good and they have entertainment while you eat. We made our own waffles which I like. We had family come back to the hotel and we sat out side at the gazzebo then moved in to one of the sitting rooms on the second floor.. The front desk personel were very helpful and we will definatly return

Reviews.Title: “The Best weekend ever”
Reviews.Author: stillprecious68
Reviews.Content: We went on a weekend retreat with our marriage class and we stayed in the room with the Hawaiian Theme. I felt like I was in Hawaii. We had a blast. The pools were amazing. We hopped from pool to pool. But we truly loved the scenery. We felt like we were in the mid evil times. We will be coming back and we will bring our children in the future.. Thank you Settle Inn for an amazing weekend. Your staff was very helpful and kind... God Bless you all William and Lori Smith Strafford Missouri

Reviews.Title: “The Stone Castle, formerly Settle Inn, is the best all around place to stay when visiting Branson.”
Reviews.Author: LDH3
Reviews.Content: I love staying at The Stone Castle when I am in Branson. It is the hotel we always stay at. It has a great location. It is not far off of highway 76. It is very close to the outlet malls, Branson Landing, White Water, and not too far from Silver Dollar City. There are a couple of nice restaurants or fast food joints very near, along with a couple of mini-golf courses. The rooms are always very clean and have a coffee pot, blow dryer, and cable tv. There are a couple of swimming pools and hot tubs available that are open early in the morning to very late at night. In the morning you can enjoy a free breakfast with many choices. They have scrambled eggs, biscuits and gravy, waffles, hot and cold cereal, and even donuts! There is also a variety of beverages. All of the staff at The Stone Castle are always very friendly and helpful if you have any questions about anything. It is no wonder The Stone Castle is the only place I want to stay when I am in Branson!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, very quiet.”
Reviews.Author: CountryMomx2
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Settle Inn newly renamed to Stone Castle Hotel & Conference Center was great. Our room was clean, functional and quiet. We have 2 young boys and they loved the swimming pools (both of them). We had a regular room and not a suite and found that we had adiquate room for the 4 of us. Breakfast was good and always had a good selection. The folks at the front desk had an answer for every question. The hotel is located just off the road on the yellow route so we did not have any traffic noise. There was plenty of well-lit parking even with a conference going on in the hotel. We were close to lots of mini golf and restaurants. All roads to 76 were easily accessed. My husband and I were very pleased and will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Real nice people, room not the same”
Reviews.Author: pott1
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights, room was very small and was damp and musty. We complained about the air being damp and a strong odor. The staff who was very friendly tried cleaning the AC unit, however it didn't help. On day 2, we found a bug in bed, checked out. The room was like being in a cave with a bad smell. We were refunded 2 nights of our stay. No complaints on the staff, they were helpfull and nice.

Reviews.Title: “This is our home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: khem1230
Reviews.Content: This is our home away from home. We absolutely love this place! We stay here everytime we come to Branson. Centrally located right off "the main strip," The Stone Castle offers convenience, luxury, and a cozy atmosphere for the entire family. All rooms are clean and nonsmoking. There is a convenient onsight restaurant. The medieval theme brings a sense of adventure like being in a castle overlooking the lights of Branson. While the mom shops till she drops, the little girls and I always enjoy the huge indoor pool and hot tub no matter what the seasons brings outside. We highly recommend this place to anyone who has children or to the couple who wants to rekindle the fire in their marriage. Wonderful place!

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Stay in Branson”
Reviews.Author: CJTKansasCity
Reviews.Content: I recently took a quick weekend getaway to Branson with my mom and little girl. We found this delightful hotel called The Stone Castle (formerly known as Settle Inn). It's right off the main drag and strikingly nestled into the Ozark hillside. It's a lovely facility that gives off a castle-like feeling, complete with medieval knight right there at the entrance to greet you. The landscape is lovely and the buildings are well kept and clean. The room was quite comfortable and affordable. Our package included Belgian waffles and biscuits and gravy the next morning with a breathtaking view out the widespread windows in the dining room of the Ozark mountains on a crisp sunny morning. This place was just great - perfect for smaller kids. The Stone Castle will surely be our hotel of choice every time we visit Branson. I'd give it 5 out of 5 stars in its price range. Glad I found it!!!

Reviews.Title: “A great and accomadating stay.”
Reviews.Author: bigbass1
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay. Everything really worked out great from the location of the hotel to the location of our room in the hotel. The castle setting was a hot topic for our 2 year old daughter. Anytime we were going back to the hotel she would repeatedly say castle!castle!. The room was clean and the breakfast was not only great but helpful for the pocketbook as well as easy to do with a 2 & 4 year old.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful ..........”
Reviews.Author: stlcardsfans
Reviews.Content: This hotel met and surpassed our expectations. The rooms were average hotel size but very nice. The beds not your average "hotel" beds. The bedding was very nice (large throw pillows and upscale comforters). Very comfortable. You can see the new renovation and it is very nice. The TV was a bit small for my husband but fine for me. (I dont go on vacation to sit in the hotel and watch TV) The rooms were very clean. (Expecially the bathroom). VERY important! They offered breakfast and it was much more than your average cereal and donuts. They had biscuts and gravy, waffle stations, cereal, bagels, toast, oatmeal, donuts, juice, milk, and coffee. The room they serve it in is huge. There was always enough seating. They also offered entertainment. You can not go wrong with this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “One of Branson's nicer places to stay”
Reviews.Author: travelguru1988
Reviews.Content: Stone Castle Resort and Conference Center as it is now known, is one of Branson's better places to stay. Rooms were clean and beds were comfortable. However, the rooms and the bathroom were REALLY small. We requested a rollaway, but there was no place to put it and they were kind enough to reverse the charge. The hotel does not have connecting rooms, but they do have a limited number of family suites (so book early if this is what you need). Great air conditioning in the room, hallway was very warm. Rooms were quite, couldn't hear thru the walls or if anyone was in the hallway. Offered a free hot breakfast frin 6am until 10am, which consisted of eggs, biscuits, gravy, belgian waffles, cereals, juices, milk, coffee. It was good, but they need to try and offer some sort of breakfast meat. Indoor pool/jacuzzi areas were very plain and small for such a large hotel. Overall, a nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: stevesonvacation
Reviews.Content: At the last minute my wife, son, and I decided to go to Branson Missouri. We live three hours away from there and usually go to Branson once a month or more. (Its a real fun place to visit with lots to do!!) On our way we picked up a Motel/Hotel discount book and found the add for this motel. We usually stay at another motel in Branson that cost over $80 per night, but with this coupon we found it would only cost us just over half that on a room. We decided to try it. The motel was easy to find even though its off the main road. The desk clerks were friendly and check in time only took no more than 10 minutes. And that was without reservations. There are two swimming pools and hot tubs as well as a free breakfast of eggs, biscuits and gravy, cereal, donuts, waffles, and more. The rooms are very clean and cozy. There is also a very good restaurant near by with in walking distance. The parking lot is easy to navigate in and to park my big truck was easy. Check out was quick and easy too. Although we only stayed one night I will definitely stay at this Motel again and again and again...

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best In Branson”
Reviews.Author: bolione
Reviews.Content: The rooms were clean. Close to all attractions ans Lake. Great indoor pools and hot tubs. Beds were very comforable. Lots of Parking and Great Breakfast!!! We will definetly stay at this hotel again. Thank you!!!

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: OklahomaMamaw
Reviews.Content: After a long day of riding a motorcyle, imagine our surprise when we checked into our room. The gal behind the desk was super friendly and was very helpful when we asked questions about Branson. The room was excellent, very clean and the bed was so-o-o comfortable--and we were so glad the indoor pool and hot tub stayed open till 1:00 a.m. What better way to cool off that sunburn we had gotten from riding and soak away the tired muscles! This is a quiet, out of the hustle and bustle, kind of place, but, yet, so close to all the activities. Oh, yeah! Their breakfast is great, and the ladies that prepared and served it were more than willing to do whatever it took to see that your were satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “It was one of the most best stays”
Reviews.Author: gbackin89
Reviews.Content: They have some of the most nice people working for them. Whenever you need anything they are always right there for you.

Reviews.Title: “Fun for Everyone”
Reviews.Author: rev4kids
Reviews.Content: We brought a youth group to Silver Dollar City for Young Christian's Weekend. The weekend ended up being cold, rainy and snowy, but we made the most of it, spending a great deal of time at our hotel. The rooms were spacious and comfortable. The pool and arcades were a life-saver. We also has a scavenger hunt that spanned all three buildings. A great activity to occupy a big group of teens. The hotel personnel were gracious and accommodating. Thank you for helping us make the most of our weekend!

Reviews.Title: “still great”
Reviews.Author: luv2go2places
Reviews.Content: We've been here before in a jacuzzi room, which was very nice, and we enjoyed our stay this time just as much as the last. Great indoor pools-not crowded at all. Great location, accessable but not too much traffic. Quiet and clean! Beds agreeable not too firm and not too soft. No probs like other reviewer. We had a travel mag. and used the coupons. We come to Branson a lot and have stayed in several hotels like Clairion and Comfort Inn. We like this one best. Good price with coupon from MWTravelBuddy.com . Good breakfast and a/c good. Coming back in a week and bringing family.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay at a great price.”
Reviews.Author: Marilynjoyw
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed the accomodations at the Settle Inn in Branson MO. The accomodations were clean and comfy. The complimentary breakfast was yummy and we had entertainment to boot!!! Great value and fun.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: okteacher
Reviews.Content: The highlight of the hotel was the desk staff. The room was clean too. The problems we saw were - hotel is older and needs help. The wireless internet did not work and we were basically told - "Sorry" and they couldn't do anything about it. The AC did not work well and kept the room just tolerably cool. The bathroom door locks when you turn the lock left and then it locks again if you turn it very far to the right. It was a constant job to make sure you didn't lock yourself out. We had a balcony that had a door that wouldn't lock. In fact, it had a hole where some kind of lock used to be. The cable tv was horrible. We got bad reception and approx 15 channels - most of which were news or informational. After a long hot day, sometimes you want to lay in a cool room and watch a little TV. No Disney, no movies, no CMT, .... At the end of our hallway there was a window that was open with a screen that was popped loose to leave an opening that dropped 3 stories to the ground....safe? Maybe not important to others, but I look forward to literature like the Branson travel guide that is available in most hotel rooms. I like to read the information and go through the coupons. There was nothing in our rooms at all to help plan the trip. We stayed one night in this hotel and moved to another for the remainder of our stay. The other hotel was less expensive and much better.

Reviews.Title: “Very good stay, excellent, professional staff; will come again.”
Reviews.Author: unitymbc
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Settle Inn, Branson on June 25, 2009 was excellent with no problems or complaints. The staff at the front desk was very curtious, helpful, and professional. The price of the room was very reasonable. We will definetly stay at this hotel again. Thank You.

Reviews.Title: “what a blast”
Reviews.Author: smhu
Reviews.Content: we have stayed at the settle inn many times, because its close to everything. all the attractions and plus the lake. after we get done doing everything during the day its nice to know we can come back to our hotel , kick back and relax in the nice clean and up to date rooms. then we go down to the pool area for the rest of the evening and just have fun in pool and hot tub. then we know when we wake up in the morning we have a nice breakfast waiting for us. no fuss and no mess to clean up. thats what a vacation is for, were mom gets a break to. and what helps out the most is the price. we always use the coupon in the hotel book and we get a great rate. i told two different families i met at the lake this weekend were we stayed out, how nice and affordable it is. they said the would drive by and check it out. when you have fun you want everyone to know about it. so i tell everyone i meet to stay here. thats no lie... we will continue to stay here as long as the price is good. because its hard to afford a nice place to stay and do everything we came to branson to do. but at the settle inn we can do it all. my husband and i have also stayed in two different theme rooms here and there romantic, peasceful and fun to stay in a different theme room each time, cant wait to have another romantic night with my sweetie. our 1st anniv. was this last weekend but we brought our kids with us. sorry to say no romance when the kids are running around. darn the luck !! but as a family we had a wonderful time here anyway. we spent two nights and it wasnt enough time. but we will be back again sometime. hopefully soon. thanks sheila unger

Reviews.Title: “Great place for families!”
Reviews.Author: deesmoke
Reviews.Content: My husband, two boys, and I stayed at the Stone Castle and loved it! We did not make reservations due to the fact we are always looking for great deals and try to stay at townhouses or cabins. We were very tired and decided to find a place close by the strip instead of venturing out to find a nice little cabin. We are so glad we did! We stayed in a family suite that had three beds! Our boys got to sleep by themselves! The rooms were neat, clean, and roomy! We had a fridge, ironing board, and even two televisions...no fighting over the show to watch at night. The price was unbeatable, the staff was helpful, and the breakfast (Which was included) was fantastic! We have found the best place in Branson to stay every year!

Reviews.Title: “New Name-Same Great Amenities!”
Reviews.Author: CDTreckin
Reviews.Content: We spent a few days at Settle Inn Branson with a new name on the sign The Stone Castle. Our previous stay proved to be a great experience, and this time was once again very pleasing. We have noticed continual improvements which have served to raise the level of our experience. We will plan to stay the next time we are in Branson.

Reviews.Title: “relaxing stay”
Reviews.Author: kthexton
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Branson Settle Inn over the week-end. Our room was extremely clean and our 9 year old son really loved the pictures dipicting King Arthur, Guinieviere, Sir Lancelot and Merlin. They had a very good selection for breakfast and we greatly enjoyed the pool and hot tub after a long hot sweaty day at Silver Dollar City!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Settle Inn/Stone Castle”
Reviews.Author: winflack
Reviews.Content: The family and I stayed two nights at the newly renovated Stone Castle Hotel in Branson. Check in was great. They actually let us check in early which was nice because it was very hot during our time in Branson and we were ready to get in out of the heat and relax for awhile. By request, we were placed in one of the three buildings that had a pool. Two buildings have indoor pools whereas the main building has the conference room/ breakfast area. The room was very nice. You could definitly tell that they put some time and money into the renovation. The beds were comfy and the a/c worked great. Since it was so hot during our stay, in the 100's, the indoor pool was very inviting. My oldest son and I spent a great amount of time in the pool. When he wasn't in the pool, he was in the gameroom which is right next to the pool. Breakfast consisted of waffles, donuts, scrambled eggs, biscuits and gravy, and juice. There were two ladies that set up the breakfast and they both were so nice each morning. The best part of the breakfast was the live entertainment. I had never stayed at a hotel in branson where they provide morning entertainment. The music was provided by Cowboy Tucker and Mr. Yeary. They are part of a show in the Branson area. They are funny and have wonderful voices. Mr. Yeary approached me and we talked about my youngest son who was sitting with me at breakfast. On the last day, three of the five daughters of the Warnock family came in and sang a song and gave out discount coupons for their show located at the Branson Mall. If you have time, check them out. A very talented family. Love Branson. Loved the Settle Inn/Stone Castle. Look forward to staying there again!!!

Reviews.Title: “What a nice visit to the Settle Inn in Branson, Missouri”
Reviews.Author: Momofboys63764
Reviews.Content: A recent trip to the Settle Inn in Branson, Missouri proved to be one of our nicest visits there. We enjoyed the wonderful location of the Settle Inn, the clean rooms, nice staff, and hot breakfast. We have stayed at this location twice in the last year and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: LeesieB
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed the indoor pool! My son loved the decor...the pictures showed knights and "fair maidens." The staff was very friendly and helpful. We intend to stay there next time we are in Branson.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent-going back soon!”
Reviews.Author: Momma00
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised with the hotel. It has 2 indoor pools and hot tubs. the rooms are especially nice with beautiful furnishings. The breakfast was amazing too!

Reviews.Title: “Great room,and fast and friendly service.”
Reviews.Author: funinbranson
Reviews.Content: The room was clean, and comfortable. The location is just great. We had no problem getting to any of the attractions that we wanted to see. And the price was wonderful also for the quality of the room.

Reviews.Title: “great”
Reviews.Author: centralbaptistchurch
Reviews.Content: We were so plesed with the outside look of the hotel and just as plesed with our rooms. They were clean and the furnishing were very nice. The staff was very nice and very helped us with any questions. The pools were very clean and the breakfast was great. We plan on staying in this hotel on our next trip to Branson.

Reviews.Title: “We Will Go Back!”
Reviews.Author: JoeUSAFRetired
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the The Stone Castle Hotel & Conference Center (formerly the Settle Inn) for 2 nights, June 3 and 4. I made reservations a few days before with Amber. She was very pleasant and we talked about some of the negative remarks that have been made. As the hotel has just went thru an extensive remodel, we decided to give it a try and hope for the best (and glad we did!) On arrival, Alissa checked us in and gave a detailed briefing on the facilities. The room we stayed in on was very clean and the beds were more comfortable than our own at home. We had a coffeemaker in the room but did not use it as there was a small coffee/tea bar just down the hall. There was an iron and ironing board but we did not use them, but it was a nice idea for those having conventions, etc. An excellent breakfast buffet (coffee, orange juice, donuts, 2 large containers of scrambled eggs, same with biscuits and same with 2 sausage gravy containers…as one went close to empty, it was removed and refilled. In addition there were 2 make-your-own waffle machines. They had a Dining area person assigned who stayed right there all the time, not someone from the desk as happens in some places. We ate a good breakfast both mornings, while being entertained by 2 great local performers, Denny Yeary and “Marshall” Tucker….boy could they sing! NOTE: The Dining area had about 15 large round tables, with 8-10 chairs each…a lot of room and a lot of seating. Between shows, we enjoyed an indoor pool and the hot tub. The pool had a enough towels available so you did not have to use your ones from your room. There is a pool in each of the two adjacent buildings. (The main building has the dining area, the other two has the pools.) Location just off Green Mountain Drive tends to be quite...good. The entire complex is non-smoking, which is a real plus for us…..Bottom Line….would we go back…You Bet! .

Reviews.Title: “Our trip was wonderful!!”
Reviews.Author: Tom064
Reviews.Content: We have never seen cleaner rooms, a cleaner pool, and the staff could not have been nicer. we look foreward to staying again when we are in Branson. The location is excellent!

Reviews.Title: “The most comfortable hotel in Branson”
Reviews.Author: catfishqueen52
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Settle Inn are very friendly and accomodating any time day or night. The rooms are very clean and have plenty of room with the most comfortable beds for a good night's sleep. We like having coffee in our room and the convenience of having an iron and ironing board. They have a wonderful breakfast buffet with entertainment in the mornings (at no extra cost). The location is great, distant enough to be quiet and close enough to enjoy all the activities offered in Branson. When away from home, the most important thing for us is having a comfortable bed to sleep in and to have the comforts of home. We get all that at the Settle Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Treats Handicap People Terribly”
Reviews.Author: tshrakes
Reviews.Content: This is the last vacation we'll ever get with our mother. When we order our rooms we was suppose to get a hadicap accesible. When we got there they didnt have what we ordered and paid for. My mother couldnt even get in the room past the bed with her wheel chair. Then she had to sleep in a recliner that was broke down and the foot rest wouldnt stay up. She cried all night in pain. When we tried to talk to the the desk manager she wouldnt do anything for us. finally the General manager came back after we was there a night and I talked to her and she accomidated my family. We was severally over charged for the room due to Branson Travel Agency. The sheets was not changed in our rooms the beds had just been made and there was hair all ove them. The rooms was infested with fleas. The only other workers in the hotel that was of any assistants was the night time maintenance that tried to help with our mother. We heard other elderly peopke having problems also. This hotel my family will never stay at again or recommend to anyone. If you stay there and your elderly, good luck.

Reviews.Title: “Neat, and Handy for places in Branson”
Reviews.Author: nuvi25
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel very handy to get to and out of in Branson. We had our grandson with us and we all enjoyed the pool and hot tub. The entertainment and free breakfast was awesome. They also had a neat gift shop, the lady was really friendly that was running it. Everyone was really nice to us. The room was really nice and the beds were really comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “We love staying there, everything from staff to service is wonderful.”
Reviews.Author: Storrer
Reviews.Content: We love the location, because it is off the strip, yet close. The staff is always very friendly and always very accomodating. Our rooms are always clean and decorated nicely. The breakfast is delicious. We have availability to pools, which is nice.

Reviews.Title: “An awesome experience.”
Reviews.Author: strawberrykiwi1414
Reviews.Content: This hotel had very good service and was extremely friendly. The themed rooms met all expectations and made our stay in Branson even more enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel had excellent location and was nice.”
Reviews.Author: caslcasl
Reviews.Content: We appreciated the hotel's location that was convenient and accessible via relatively un-congested roads, which is a major advantage in Branson.

Reviews.Title: “If you want A little R and R...”
Reviews.Author: amlove555
Reviews.Content: Each time I come to Branson i stay here and Im never disappointed. You can't go wrong with the beautiful room, excellent location, and friendly staff. Great value!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay, great service”
Reviews.Author: golfer1s
Reviews.Content: The Settle Inn is a great place to stay. The room was very clean and the service was great. Great value.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and restfull”
Reviews.Author: ray36
Reviews.Content: The location is good. We found everything clean and the service excellent. They have a very good hot breakfast bar and live music entertainment also as you eat. Two indoor pools.

Reviews.Title: “The staff was friendly and rooms are clean.”
Reviews.Author: ksfarmgirl3699
Reviews.Content: The staff was friendly and very quick at fixing a problem. Are tv was not working when we checked in but they changed it as we called which was at 11pm. The rooms were clean, bathroom is extremely small and crowded, barely enough room to turn around. Pools were clean but old looking. Hot tub was hot first night but cold second night. Breakfast was pretty good, good entertainment with breakfast. Downfall no mini fridge or microwave. Family had an enjoyable time. Would proabely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “economical with lots of perks”
Reviews.Author: fourpetesake
Reviews.Content: My daughter, granddaughter and I stayed three nights at Settle Inn. We had wonderfully comfortable beds and a great clean room 3 doors from the swimming pool and hot tub. My granddaughter loved that pool and I loved the hot tub. Every morning we enjoyed the entertainment in the large breakfast room while eating the free breakfast buffet. Couldn't ask for anything more.

Reviews.Title: “Very Friendly Staff And excellent Clean Room.”
Reviews.Author: blueeyes72444
Reviews.Content: Great Rooms and excellent Service. The rooms were very nice and We loved the Jacuzzi tub. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “beautiful”
Reviews.Author: joann63
Reviews.Content: the hotel was very artistic, the workmanship of the building was just beautiful, i think it was the largest hotel in Branson. the characteristic of the furniture and art in the room was excellent. wonderful in door pool and hot tub/spa. great complimentary breakfast. our lodging experience at the settle inn was just great, i would recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “2nd stay and still loving it!”
Reviews.Author: funfur2
Reviews.Content: Great Great GREAT!!!! The price was very good and they had made improvements in the short 5 weeks between trips. The first time the hot tub was a little dirty and the breakfast not so great. Still a nice stay though. By our 2nd trip only a few weeks later they have added a full breakfast and the pools and hot tubs were clean! I have a 3 year old daughter who doesn't want to stay any other place than "Shrek's Castle" She thinks the Knight on the horse on the far end looks like Shrek. :) We will be coming back again! I have been going to branson at least 3 times a year since I was 7 and this is one of the best places we have stayed! I took my parents with me the last time and they will now be staying here when they go back.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Pleasurable”
Reviews.Author: funsun5
Reviews.Content: The kids loved the design of the hotel. The shape of the castle and all the statues around was neat. I liked that the pool was open from 6am to 1 am. It was very convient. We didnt have to work around our schedule to swim. It was open late enough that we got to see the attractions around Branson without having to rush, just to go and relax in the pool. The stay was very enjoyable. It had a great selection for breakfast and a show to watch also. There was a game room to keep the kids from getting board. The family loved it so much we already have book there again for a week. It was a great hotel with great staff.

Reviews.Title: “Familiy's favorite place to stay in Branson!”
Reviews.Author: Annhoffman
Reviews.Content: My family and I have been to Branson many times, on the average twice a year for the last 30 years. Needless to say, we have stayed at almost every hotel/motel in Branson. Some of the places are a whole lot better than others and the Settle Inn is the best of all. At first when I saw this big, magnificent hoteI that looked like a castle I thought that it would be way too much to stay there. My Son was very young at the time and wanted to stay there as he liked knights and horses and they have statues of them at the entrance and inside the building, We decided to humor ourselves and stop by and see how much a room would be and we found that it was quite affordable and had many extras to offer. They give a nice brakfast, sometimes with entertainment and a pool and hot tub that is open from 6 am to 1 am. The kids loved this and so do we as we can use these after shows or before we start our day. We have also rented a theme room and that was really fun. Also, it is very safe there with security cameras and entrances from the inside. Sometimes we get coupons in the travel books and can save money. This truly is our favorite place to stay in Branson for both the parents and the kids. The Settle Inn will only enhance your vacation and I think it will become your family's favorite place to stay too,

Reviews.Title: “It Is Good To Feel Safe”
Reviews.Author: birdyArkansas
Reviews.Content: I am notorious for forgetting my room key and having to ask the cleaning people (because they are usually the closest ones around) to let me in my room. This time though at my stay at Settle Inn, the young man doing the cleaning very politly insisted on having me identify something that only I would know about in my room. I was very impressed with his professionalizim as well as his politness. I also slept much better knowing that the hotel employed such conciensious people.

Reviews.Title: “Average.”
Reviews.Author: marthabeans
Reviews.Content: The standard rooms are cramped with very poor lighting. I'm sure a suite would have been much better, but I didn't want to pay the extra amount. The room was a great value. For the location and breakfast, it was priced well. My room was dusty, which made me think that maybe it wasn't too clean. Since the lighting was so bad, I couldn't really tell how clean it actually was. Most of the staff was very nice and accommodating. There seemed to be some clueless stares when I would ask a question, but usually they figured it out. The TV's need to be replaced/upgraded and the channel selection was not great. However, if you're going to Branson to see Branson, this is a perfectly adequate hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay at Settle Inn was top notch.”
Reviews.Author: zoefit5
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Settle Inn was very pleasant. We found the room clean and comfortable. The location was easy access and we will probably stay there again the next time we are in Branson.

Reviews.Title: “It was a very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: racecardreamer
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very pleasant. I found it very comfortable and relaxing. The atmosphere was nice and friendly. The beds were comfortable and a good size. It was rather quiet too considering there was several groups staying there the same weekend that our church stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Branson.”
Reviews.Author: Arnie167
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff and the location made getting around in Branson very easy.

Reviews.Title: “perfect weekend getaway.”
Reviews.Author: bugsy1234
Reviews.Content: we went too branson for our anniversery, and found this gem of a motel on the internet. perfect..... we loved the rooms and the fact that we had a wirl pool tub in our room, it wasnt the one we reserved. but when the motel employes found out it was our anniversery, they hooked us up. the aloha suite was sweet. we went on too enjoy the elvis inpersonator they have in the breakfast nook every morning, he was great, hate too go home, but we will be back. the place was perfect. and the service was great. keep it up branson .you are doing a great job of taking care of your customers.what a place.

Reviews.Title: “castle of the ozarks”
Reviews.Author: dukeKansas
Reviews.Content: were from kansas and stayed two nights, was beautiful, nestled in the mountain side, built with a castle theme, the people went out of their way to serve us, the rooms where clean the service was great! would highly recommend to couples for honeymoons it has theme rooms, cool! and for families with children it has an indoor pool. located just one block off the main strip in branson, it has a great location to all the shows and eating establishments. great place to stay.... we'll go back again!

Reviews.Title: “Great service and room accommidations”
Reviews.Author: believr
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a weekend vacation trip. The hotel was centrally located to all attractions and the price was affordable.. The service and room was great. Nice pool and jucuzzi. Had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Knight delight”
Reviews.Author: fastpacker
Reviews.Content: Our visit to the Settle Inn was a true delight. When we entered our room it didn't have that normal hotel room feel. It was well decorated and lit, very clean, really nice beds, and spacious. The room had a really nice view of Branson too. Then as we left our room I noticed that old familiar smell of chlorine...lol which led us to 2 yes count'em 2 indoor pools and hot tubs complete with game room! I would have to say it was a nice surprise. I think the thing I got the kick out of most though was the armored knights standing and mounted on horses; Standing guard over the well castle themed hotel. It was a great stay and yes we will be back. Thankyou Settle Inn for such a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing weekend with my family in a beautiful setting.”
Reviews.Author: Louise007Missouri
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay at the Settle Inn in Branson MO, and we have never been dissappointed in anything there. The rooms are beautiful, our kids think it is the greatest place we stay at, and we travel quite a bit. Friendly, helpful staff, always clean.

Reviews.Title: “This is a fun place to stay and I would recommend it!”
Reviews.Author: jab0509
Reviews.Content: The staff was very friendly and our room was a lot of fun. We stayed in the Royal Chambers. The room had several windows and the jacuzzi tub was huge.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay for families, lots of room, pools, game room, etc.”
Reviews.Author: livinoz
Reviews.Content: Our family has stayed in several of Branson's Hotels and Motels and Settle Inn has become one of our favorites. There are two pools so we don't have the problem of pool overcrowding. Along that some line, the breakfast area is huge and so you don't have to fight for a seat (or your food!) On the weekends and busier times, they have two separate areas for breakfast which helps even more. On our last visit we accidently left my son's beloved baby blanket in our room. After I made a few phone calls, his blanket was located and sent home safely. What a relief! I was very happy with the employees going the extra mile!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: Humvee206
Reviews.Content: Arrived late in the day without reservations.. staff was very undrstanding. they indicated that they had a youth group staying in one of the buildings and could put us in one of their suites for a few dollars more. absolutely one of the best rooms I have been in.. Will stay again and will tell other travelers of the service..

Reviews.Title: “What a weekend! What a Hotel! Indoor Pools that were actually warm!”
Reviews.Author: StraffordMommy
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights during a marriage retreat. We could not believe how warm the swimming pool was. Our room actually had a waterfall that ran the water into a jacuzzi just for 2. Ask for the Camelot room it is the BEST!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was faboulus”
Reviews.Author: roadrunner18
Reviews.Content: This was one of the cleanest hotels we have stayed in a long time. The continental breakfast was also very good. The indoor swimming pool and hot tub was both clean and relaxing. we had a great time and all the staff was very nice. The rooms are well insulated so you do not hear noise in the hallways. The room was well decorated and we loved the pillow-top comfort beds. This hotel is in an excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tjdjones
Reviews.Content: The Settle Inn Branson was an excellent choice. The man that took the reservation was very helpful. When arriving to the motel, both ladies at the office were friendly. The facility was clean. We have stayed at this location on two other occassions and plan to return in the next time we go to Branson.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay at Settle Inn”
Reviews.Author: autoglass
Reviews.Content: Our stay was great!! Great service, great rooms, and great facility. Highly recommended was there for a marraige retreat, it was awsome

Reviews.Title: “My kids had a blast,from the breakfast show to the late pool hours!”
Reviews.Author: chancerpants
Reviews.Content: The Settle Inn was very kid friendly. The suite was big enough for the kids to have space to play and not be on top of us. Their favorite part was the breakfast show, the entertainer included them at intermission and they went home and told everyone they were IN the show! The extended pool hours are great, you can swim before you start your day and after you return from sightseeing. The washer and dryer were ann added plus, especially when traveling with 4 kids. The microwave and fridge came in very handy for the kids special snacks. The beds were comfy and the sheets were soft, which is hard to find in some hotels. We will definitley go back again.

Reviews.Title: “amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: nova075
Reviews.Content: this was a very nice motel has swimming pools hot tubs and arcade. the only thing they could use there is a restaurant would make it alot better. and there new beds are awsome they are very comfortable. the room looks so relaxing when you walk in to it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice family Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TRAVELFUN2009
Reviews.Content: Easy to locate, rooms clean and comfortable. Nice breakfast room with friendly staff and plenty of food. 2 heated Pools and arcade recreation for the kids. Price is right for Branson.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Room and Service!”
Reviews.Author: smiley1231
Reviews.Content: This is an awesome hotel! We stayed for 2 nights and loved it! We stayed in one of their themed rooms and really enjoyed it. You can tell that they really worked to make the rooms enjoyable. We will be making a yearly visit!

Reviews.Title: “Ice Storm Relief at the Settle Inn”
Reviews.Author: HeartlandMissouri
Reviews.Content: Settle Inn was a refuge for our family during the 2009 Ice Storm. We had no power in Southern Missouri and Arkansas and the Settle Inn offered to help all storm victims at a special rate to help those in need. The staff had hot coffee, tea and donuts waiting for us with checkin and were flexible with checkin and checkout times as we were waiting for power returns in our own homes. The hotel is cozy and the beds were comfortable. Of course the kids loved the two indoor pools.

Reviews.Title: “Fun”
Reviews.Author: arhomegirl
Reviews.Content: Very nice location in Branson off of the strip. Very nice rooms. I really enjoy the theme jacuzzi rooms.

Reviews.Title: “I'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: Lovein_Travel
Reviews.Content: I travel all over the world for business and this was my first stay at the Settle Inn. What a delight! They just upgraded all of their rooms and did a great job. My room was cozy and comfortable and quiet. The only complaint I had was the weather... it was cold but that wasn't any fault of the hotel! I'll be making at least quarterly trips to Branson and the Settle Inn is my new home away from home! The staff was not only professional but warm and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “This Place Is Crap”
Reviews.Author: blazer63
Reviews.Content: This is the worst place that I have ever stayed at. Breakfast was pathetic. front desk person that checked us in Alicia, Alisha, whatever paid more attention to my husband and little to no attention to me. If shes trying to pick up someones husband she needs to get on the streets! Rooms were small and dark. My sister and her husband stayed in a theme room that they are supposedly be famous for. Its just a mural on a wall. We will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay at the Settle Inn....Settle in somewhere else in Branson!”
Reviews.Author: midnightseashell
Reviews.Content: Hotel had NO INTERNET SERVICE ENTIRE WEEK. MOST OF WEEK CABLE & PHONES WERE DOWN, except for inhouse calling. Stay for convention...place was filthy....nothing was clean. breakfast? never saw it...oh unless they mean the old fruit on the table with the juice. The staff couldn't get any dumber. The only business this place to seems to have is the tour buses the elderly travelers take. All 3 bldgs are old and need to be updated.. not with paint either...i mean gutted & refinished completely. The bathroom is so small & dirty you couldn't stand to touch anything in it. I had lysol to clean before we touched anything. The beds were very very nasty.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: diane_StPaul
Reviews.Content: While we liked alot about the hotel, there were also alot of things we didn't like. The breakfast at the hotel was great but the selection as it got later was not very good. It would also have benefitted from a few simple things such as real cream, not coffeemate; tongs to remove toast, bagels and muffins from the toasters so that you weren't burning your fingers; and more variety of fruits. Actually, more variety in general would have been great, after staying a week we were pretty tired of the food. The swimming pool was another issue as it was closed for cleaning in our building during the middle of the week and you had to go outside to reach the other pool in another building. My kids of course had to go and almost froze to death. We should have been told at check in that they were having to close it. The rooms were nice - fairly large - cleaned every day and we were very satisfied. The only complaint was that the dressing mirror and sinks were actually part of the room, not part of the bathroom. Anyone wanting to get up before the rest of the family and try to get dressed and go for early breakfast, a swim or a run, woke up everyone else. The garbage trucks waking us up did not make us happy either. Location was great! Off the main drive but close was a huge benefit. Price was wonderful! As a whole, due to the price and convenience, we might stay there again but I would certainly also look at other establishments.

Reviews.Title: “don't settle for this settle inn!!”
Reviews.Author: krazbeanz
Reviews.Content: The first thing I noticed is the hallways were very dark even in daytime. My room was very small, again very poor lighting. The bathroom door hits the toilet when you close it. The sink is very narrow. I was told the place had been remodeled, I guess they meant new paint which is all dark colors and new carpet. A large armoire had a very small tv. The staff likes to park their cars very close to all entry ways even at the expense of making it difficult to get into the buildings. After 10pm at night a staff member was running a vacuum cleaner in the hallway, not just one spot, the entire hallway! 2 people in my group had door locks that would not work properly on their rooms. The hotel said no other rooms were available to switch and a locksmith was not available to fix the locks. My friends had to prop a chair under the doorknob to be secure. Cold breakfast! Look elsewhere!!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff, Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: B2J
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable hotel. Friendly staff, eager to please. Would definitely recommend to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy Bathroom, Maid Service Terrible, Front Desk No Help At All”
Reviews.Author: ccpaly
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a room reserved at Settle Inn for a 3 night stay through a vacation package offer. We requested a king sized bed which they said they would do, but upon arrival, we were told none were available. Since this was right after Christmas there weren't many people staying there and half the property was closed off. We were told they only had 8 king sized beds total and they were all taken. Then when we got to the room it was so small, and the bathroom had MOLD growing around the tile area. I called the front desk and was told the maid would come clean the room plus it had a musty smell. The next day we left to see some sites, and when we returned the bathroom was still the same......MOLD still there.....and the bed was half made. I had written a note to the maid to please spray bleach on the shower and tub, but this did not happen. The room was filthy and disgusting! Needless to say, we left after 2 nights and came home. We did not enjoy this vacation at all, and it was a total waste of time and money to stay here. My advice is to STAY AWAY FROM THIS MOTEL! There are others around the area that hopefully are cleaner and respect their guests.

Reviews.Title: “Great Beds”
Reviews.Author: dreamingvacations
Reviews.Content: This is a great motel to stay in. Clean. The best beds and pillows I have ever slept on in a motel. Their prices are very reasonable!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: bdmauk24
Reviews.Content: 2d time to stay at this hotel. Best value in Branson. $45/nt. 2, count 'em 2, separate indoor pools and hot tubs! No worry about pools full of kids. Rooms are fine, nothing fancy. Beds could be softer. Like the "off the Strip" location. Would recommend and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “This place will rip you off and it sucks”
Reviews.Author: hotelmanOklahoma
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last week- Problems as follows: 1) Did not honor their OWN coupon. 2) Charged my card three times-Took 10 days to clear up. 3) Rooms so small- my bathroom at home was bigger than the whole room. 4) Staff is clueless. Stay away at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “Nasty - Do Not Stay Here!!!”
Reviews.Author: mindalyn
Reviews.Content: This hotel was nasty, nasty, nasty. Did I mention that it was NASTY?? I made our reservations a couple of months in advance and the girl that took the reservations said she needed my card number to hold the room, but my card would not be charged. Three days before we checked in, my account was drafted! And, it wasn't even for the correct amount! I called and they said they just do that and that the girl that told me that no longer worked there. We checked in and the 2nd night was put on my debit card. The next morning we went to breakfast and there was hairs in the donuts!!! YUCK! The following morning we woke up on the bare mattress since they do not use fitted sheets, only flat sheets (apparently to save money). We were appauled by what we saw...HUGE STAINS on the mattress (we stayed in the Royal Chamber theme room). I told the front desk and they said they would check it out. We wandered into the breakfast room and there was hair on the milk this time. The maintenance guy said "well, it wasnt there earlier, it is probably just a guest hair". EWWWWWW! Fortunately, we were checking out anyway so we left. Now, remember, the money had already came out of my account, but they processed it again!!! I paid double! They said the "hold" they put on my account for the two nights would be released soon and it was procedure to put the hold on the account and send the actual charge through. It took nearly a week to get it released! I DEFINITELY WOULD NOT RECOMMEND STAYING AT THIS HOTEL!!! IT IS JUST NASTY. THEY WILL TAKE DOUBLE YOUR MONEY AND THEN TAKE A WEEK TO RELEASE IT BACK TO YOU!!! I RATE THIS HOTEL A F- If you stay here, don't say I didn't warn you!

Reviews.Title: “Fine For The Price!”
Reviews.Author: bwelliver
Reviews.Content: Our room was fine except a little dark. We were on the first floor so we had to keep the drapes shut. The room was nice and clean and for the price it was better than expected for us. The staff was great but the breakfast was not so great but is was good enough. Swimming area was clean and fun and everything you want to see is near this hotel. For the price we paid it was just fine! I would reccomend it to anyone looking for a little budget relief. Nice stay!

Reviews.Title: “In Need of a Complete Remodel”
Reviews.Author: speaker54
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were booked into the Settle Inn though a time share promotion company. The Settle Inn has three separate buildings and we were given a room in the oldest of the three. The hotel needs updating and cleaning. The room had one double bed and was extremely small. The smallness was accentuated by the large armoire, which made the room seem even smaller.
