The TV in the armoire was 19”. You could barely walk between the armoire and the bed. The bathroom was extremely small, with an older bath/shower and toilet. The door could hardly clear the toilet. The room smelled musty. The Settle Inn was nice about switching us to a larger room with two double beds. However, it too had a dirty feel to it. The continental breakfast is served only in the first of the three buildings, which meant walking a distance. We eventually complained to the time share promotion company, who moved us to a better motel. I’m not sure what the regular rate is for the Settle Inn, but I hope it is very low.

Reviews.Title: “Senior friendly / Cyber lacking rooms”
Reviews.Author: ATAC911
Reviews.Content: This is an economy stay at best. Meekcat's review was dead on. Rooms are kind of small, a few cobwebs seen, bathroom shower are weak and showerheads are wal-mart grade, water not real hot, but hot enough for most. Shower/tub is a deep thin walled tub that is floor level, not elevated type. AC/Heat unit is noisy, not loud enough to annoy. TV is approx 19" and channel selection is poor [local VACATION channel is informative]. There is NO internet connection [Hard Wired or Wireless access in Room/Bldgs] My room was on 3rd floor and across street from warehouse in Lancelot Bldg, 18 wheeler came in and out without any distraction [QUIET]. Staff was very friendly. Check In is slightly confusing. Settle Inn consists of 3 different Bldgs, Bldgs 1-2 are guest rooms {Bldg 1 [Lancelot] Rm #'s 100-300} {Bldg 2 has 400-600} {Bldg 3 has 700-900 and Check-in} each on a steeper progressive grade level. Basic Bottomline: If you need a place to sleep and rest, you should stay here. If you require, More high tech access, keep traveling

Reviews.Title: “Decent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Meerkat92101
Reviews.Content: This place isn't fancy. Its very much a budget based place without many frills. But if the price is right - why complain? Pluses: Good service, inexpensive, friendly, everything works, nice bath fixtures Negatives: the continental breakfast is kind of sad, but the hot breakfast isn't any better. Canned peaches made up the fruit area and the eggs were very mysterious. The water is hot, the sheets are good enough - but don't expect the Ritz.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hobbes20
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 days, 4 nights at this location and it was very clean, quiet and comfortable at a great rate. The bathroom could be a little larger but didn't plan on spending much time in it anyway. The bed was comfortable and when the TV didn't work someone was sent to replace it in 5 minutes. The continental breakfast with entertainment each morning was fantastic. The location was very convenient as well. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Theme rooms are great!”
Reviews.Author: ixxi01
Reviews.Content: All of the rooms have been completely remodeled. We stayed in one of the "theme" rooms with a 2 person jacuzzi. Had a great time!

Reviews.Title: “RUN FAST FROM THIS PLACE!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: pckim1
Reviews.Content: My family and I just got back from this place and it is my duty to everyone else to warn you!!!!! This place was a dump. The first day that we arrived, we got to our room only to find pet hair all over the bed and floors. Like they didn't vacuum after the last guest. Then when we pulled the comforter back from the head of the bed there were toenail clippings all over the floor. The window didn't lock at all nor was there any security device on it. We called the front door ASAP and they did move us over to another room. We only stayed here cuz' we got it through Stormy Point Resorts(not good for them). the second room wasn't much better. The window didn't lock again, the floors were wet under the bed, the hair dryer didn't work at all and was busted at the air intake, the bedding smelled like mildew, etc. The moring breakfast as nothing to brag about. They gave us a coupon for a 2.99 buffet, but it never happened, when we asked about it, they front dest sid they had no idea what was going on there. The buffet staff never showed up and wouldn't return any calls. This was the same for the entiire 4 days we were there. The pools were cold as well and the hot tubs. The second moring we were there I went to the hot tub at 7am. and while I was there the janitor came in to test the waters and temps. I told him that the hot tub didn't need anymore chemicals cuz; the fumes alone were buring my eyes. The next thing we noticed was later that moning the hut tub and pool were emptied and closed for repairs. Go figure. The third morning I went to the second hot tub and again the janitor came in and while I was in the hot tub he "backwashed" the hot tub and the next thing I knew was there about 50 big black bugs in the tub with me. I freaked out!!!!!! This was sick and unacceptable. I will never stay here again. I will make sure to tell people about out experence and warn them. The decor was very outdated and very dark. Funny this was the sign in front of hotel said, "2007 renovations completed!" One last note, due to the fact that they allow pets, the second night we were there we went out for a walk and someone had let their dog crap all over the hall. Not seeing it due lack of lighting and dark carpet we stepped in in and it was all over our room and children then. How sick is this!!!! So over all this was the WORST experience we have ever had and will never go back.

HotelInfo.Name: The Stone Castle Hotel & Conference Center
HotelInfo.Address: 3050 Green Mountain Drive, Branson, MO 65616
